meanings.definition: Shake or tremble with fear or nervousness.
meanings.sent1: She was quaking with fear during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: The little puppy was quaking in the corner during the loud fireworks.
meanings.sent3: The thought of giving a speech had her quaking in her boots.
meanings.sent4: His heart was quaking like a leaf in the wind as he approached the haunted house.
meanings.sent5: The ground beneath her feet was quaking with the force of her anxiety.

meanings.definition: Shake or tremble with a slight, rapid motion.
meanings.sent1: The aspen leaves were quaking in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The jello on the plate was quaking with every step she took.
meanings.sent3: The tiny bird was quaking with excitement as it hopped around the garden.
meanings.sent4: The water in the glass was quaking as the heavy truck rumbled by.
meanings.sent5: The candle flame was quaking in the draft from the window.

meanings.sent1: The quaking of the ground signaled an approaching earthquake.
meanings.sent2: The quaking of the tree branches in the wind created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent3: The quaking of the building made it seem like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The quaking of the old bridge made it unsafe to cross.
meanings.sent5: The quaking of her hands betrayed her nervousness during the interview.
